member.name: T:Google.KML.geFeature
member.summary: Represents the Feature abstract, one of the most important elements in a KML. This is what will be displayed.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Name
member.summary: The name of the feature. This will be the label that is displayed in both the Places window and the Map window

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Visibility
member.summary: Defines whether to draw the feature in the map window by default.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Open
member.summary: If the feature contains other features, defines whether this feature is expanded by default or not.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Address
member.summary: A street address

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.AddressDetails
member.summary: A structured xAL street address

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.PhoneNumber
member.summary: an RFC2806 formatted phone number

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Snippet
member.summary: Text that can be displayed under the icon in the places window, otherwise any description available is shown

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Description
member.summary: The text that is displayed in the balloon. Can be HTML formatted text. Special characters should be surrounded by special chars here

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.LookAt
member.summary: Where Google Earth should orient itself to look at this feature

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.TimePrimitive
member.summary: A specified time or range of times when this feature should be displayed. Useful for showing/hiding features while looping over a given time.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.StyleUrl
member.summary: The style this feature should use, can be relative to the document if there is one, or an http reference

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.StyleSelectors
member.summary: A collection of styles that can be used by different elements in this feature and child features

member.name: F:Google.KML.geFeature.Region
member.summary: Defines the user view bounding box for when features should be displayed

member.name: M:Google.KML.geFeature.ToKML(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the object as KML, and calls upon any children to do the same

member.summary: Represents the Document object

member.summary: A collection of Features that can exist within the container

member.name: T:Google.KML.gePoint
member.summary: A geographic location defined by longitude, latitude, and (optional) altitude. When a Point is contained by a Placemark, the point itself determines the position of the Placemark's name and icon. When a Point is extruded, it is connected to the ground with a line. This "tether" uses the current LineStyle.

member.name: T:Google.KML.geGeometry
member.summary: Represents the Geometry abstract class, which right at the moment I have no idea why Google has done this. There is no singe thing that the objects inheriting this can share. There should perhaps be a seperate abstract for Point, LineString, LinearRing, and Polygon so that they can at least share some properties.

member.name: T:Google.KML.geAngle180
member.summary: An double value that must be between -180 and 180

member.name: T:Google.KML.gePolyStyle
member.summary: Specifies the drawing style for all polygons, including polygon extrusions (which look like the walls of buildings) and line extrusions (which look like solid fences).

member.name: T:Google.KML.geColorStyle
member.summary: This is an abstract element and cannot be used directly in a KML file. It provides elements for specifying the color and color mode of extended style types.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geColorStyle.Color
member.summary: Color and opacity (alpha) values are expressed in hexadecimal notation.
member.remarks: The range of values for any one color is 0 to 255 (00 to ff). For alpha, 00 is fully transparent and ff is fully opaque. The order of expression is aabbggrr, where aa=alpha (00 to ff); bb=blue (00 to ff); gg=green (00 to ff); rr=red (00 to ff). Default value is ffffffff.
member.example: If you want to apply a blue color with 50 percent opacity to an overlay, you would specify the following: 7fff0000, where alpha=0x7f, blue=0xff, green=0x00, and red=0x00.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geColorStyle.ColorMode
member.summary: Values for colorMode are normal (no effect) and random. A value of random applies a random linear scale to the base color as follows.
member.remarks: To achieve a truly random selection of colors, specify a base color of white (ffffffff). If you specify a single color component (for example, a value of ff0000ff for red), random color values for that one component (red) will be selected. In this case, the values would range from 00 (black) to ff (full red). If you specify values for two or for all three color components, a random linear scale is applied to each color component, with results ranging from black to the maximum values specified for each component. The opacity of a color comes from the alpha component of color and is never randomized. Default value is normal.

member.name: M:Google.KML.geColorStyle.ToKML(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the object as KML, and calls upon any children to do the same

member.name: F:Google.KML.gePolyStyle.Fill
member.summary: Boolean value (default=1). Specifies whether to fill the polygon

member.name: F:Google.KML.gePolyStyle.Outline
member.summary: Boolean value (default=1). Specifies whether to outline the polygon. Polygon outlines use the current LineStyle.

member.name: M:Google.KML.gePolyStyle.ToKML(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Render to KML

member.summary: Return a byte array that is the final KML file.

member.summary: Return the compressed version of the KML file (KMZ)

member.name: T:Google.KML.geAngle90
member.summary: A double that must be between -90 and 90

member.name: T:Google.KML.geOrientation
member.summary: Describes rotation of a 3D model's coordinate system to position the object in Google Earth.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geOrientation.Heading
member.summary: Rotation about the z axis. A value of 0 (the default) equals North.
member.remarks: A positive rotation is clockwise around the z axis and specified in degrees from 0 to ±180.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geOrientation.Tilt
member.summary: Rotation about the x axis. Default equals to 0.
member.remarks: A positive rotation is clockwise around the x axis and specified in degrees from 0 to ±180.

member.name: F:Google.KML.geOrientation.Roll
member.summary: Rotation about the y axis. Default equals to 0.
member.remarks: A positive rotation is clockwise around the y axis and specified in degrees from 0 to ±180.

member.name: M:Google.KML.geOrientation.ToKML(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the object to KML.

member.name: T:Google.KML.gePlacemark
member.summary: A Placemark is a Feature with associated Geometry. In Google Earth, a Placemark appears as a list item in the Places panel. A Placemark with a Point has an icon associated with it that marks a point on the earth in the 3D viewer. (In the Google Earth 3D viewer, a Point Placemark is the only object you can click or roll over. Other Geometry objects do not have an icon in the 3D viewer. To give the user something to click, you would need to add a Point to the Polygon.)

member.name: M:Google.KML.gePlacemark.ToKML(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Render to KML
